intro: Mapania papuana, commonly known as the Papuan mapania, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and broad, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Mapania papuana is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
